description: Returns a list of virtual tape recovery points that are available for the specified tape gateway. A recovery point is a point-in-time view of a virtual tape at which all the data on the virtual tape is consistent. If your gateway crashes, virtual tapes that have recovery points can be recovered to a new gateway. This operation is only supported in the tape gateway type.

parameters.name: GatewayARN
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the  ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: GatewayARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the gateway. Use the  ListGateways operation to return a list of gateways for your account and Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: TapeRecoveryPointInfos
nested_items.description: An array of TapeRecoveryPointInfos that are available for the specified gateway.

nested_items.name: TapeARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the virtual tape.

nested_items.name: TapeRecoveryPointTime
nested_items.description: The time when the point-in-time view of the virtual tape was replicated for later recovery.

nested_items.name: TapeSizeInBytes
nested_items.description: The size, in bytes, of the virtual tapes to recover.

nested_items.name: TapeStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the virtual tapes.

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: An opaque string that indicates the position at which the virtual tape recovery points that were listed for description ended.
